intro: Pedilonum oligoblepharon, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in shaded or partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
